parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's [[Description.ext]], the campaign's description.ext or the global config.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>For greater efficiency and ease of modability it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.57.134673</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cutRsc''' [class, type, speed, showInMap] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [class, type, speed, showInMap]: [[Array]]</value></part><part><name>Parameter1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> speed (Optional): [[Number]] - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1 </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> showInMap (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [[true]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> layer '''cutRsc''' [class, type, speed, showInMap]</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layer: [[Number]] - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22 </name>=<value> [class, type, speed, showInMap]: [[Array]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER24</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> speed (Optional): [[Number]] - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1 </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER25</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p26</name>=<value> showInMap (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [[true]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER26</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> layerName '''cutRsc''' [class, type, speed, showInMap] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(''Since Arma 3 v1.57.134673'') </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p41</name>=<value> layerName: [[String]] - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER41</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p42</name>=<value> [class, type, speed, showInMap]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER42</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p43</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER43</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p44</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER44</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p45</name>=<value> speed (Optional): [[Number]] - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1 </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER45</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p46</name>=<value> showInMap (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [[true]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER46</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value> [[Number]] - number of the allocated layer </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN"];
[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];
[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2, [[false]]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>2 [[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_layer = "layer1" [[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Create IGUI display: <code>"someLayer" [[cutRsc]] ["RscTitleDisplayEmpty", "PLAIN"];
_display <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[uiNamespace]] [[getVariable]] "RscTitleDisplayEmpty";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allCutLayers]], [[titleRsc]], [[cutText]], [[cutObj]], [[cutFadeOut]], [[setTitleEffect]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 30 Jun, 2008
<dt class="note">[[User:Dr_Eyeball|Dr_Eyeball]]<dd class="note">
Using [[cutRsc]] (instead of [[titleRsc]]) for a HUD has the benefits of:
* having the HUD automatically hide itself when you access the map and redisplay itself after closing the map.<BR>
* using the 'Direct communication' chat channel messages will not interfere with the HUD by hiding it.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 17 Oct, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]<dd class="note">
Regarding removing current resource with [[cutRsc]] ["Default", "PLAIN"]. If it does't work and it gives you error message that "Default" is not found, add it by yourself to RscTitles in [[description.ext]] so it looks like this:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class RscTitles
{
	class Default 
	{
		idd = -1;
		fadein = 0;
		fadeout = 0;
		duration = 0;
	};
};
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>

Alternatively, you can use cutText, yes [[cutText]] command to cancel your resources. As Karel Moricky explains: "All 'cut' commands are in the same layer, the same as all 'title' commands are in another one." So to remove cutRsc resource execute cutText on the same layer:

<code>[[cutRsc]] ["myRsc", "PLAIN"]; //show
[[cutText]] ["", "PLAIN"]; //remove</code>

<code>10 [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc", "PLAIN"]; //show
10 [[cutText]] ["", "PLAIN"]; //remove</code>

Also if you use layers would be a good idea to register them with [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]] to avoid possible clashes with other layers:
<code>("myLayerName" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]]) [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc","PLAIN"]; //show
("myLayerName" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]]) [[cutText]] ["","PLAIN"]; //remove</code>

You can also immediately remove resource with [[cutFadeOut]] command:<code>123 [[cutFadeOut]] 0;</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
